message.content:
cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.SOC, cs.DS 

The paper deals with the problem of long tail recommendation, which is a subfield of information retrieval (cs.IR). The proposed algorithms are graph-based, which suggests that the paper could also be classified under social networks (cs.SOC) or machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper involves the use of hitting time and absorbing time algorithms, which are commonly used in the study of random walks on graphs, suggesting that the paper could also be classified under data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper proposes methods to improve recommendation diversity and accuracy, which could also be relevant to the subfield of social influence (cs.SI).
